vpcvirtualprivatecloud.eli5: A VPC is like your own private neighborhood in the cloud where your devices can talk safely.
vpcvirtualprivatecloud.boss: A Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) isolates your cloud resources in a logically separated network with full control over IP ranges and routing.
vpcvirtualprivatecloud.sysadmin: VPCs enable users to define subnets, route tables, security groups, and internet/NAT gateways within a dedicated private space in the cloud.
vpcvirtualprivatecloud.use_case: Used to isolate web servers from databases in a secure cloud environment.

subnetscloud.eli5: Cloud subnets are like rooms in your cloud house—each one has its own purpose and rules.
subnetscloud.boss: Subnets divide your VPC into smaller segments, separating resources by role, access, or environment.
subnetscloud.sysadmin: Cloud subnets define ranges of IP addresses within a VPC, assigned as public or private based on routing and security needs.
subnetscloud.use_case: Used to create separate environments for frontend and backend servers in a cloud app.

internetgateway.eli5: An internet gateway is the cloud’s front door that lets your stuff go online.
internetgateway.boss: An Internet Gateway provides your cloud-based resources with a path to access the internet.
internetgateway.sysadmin: Internet Gateways attach to VPCs to route public traffic between cloud resources and the internet using public IPs and NAT.
internetgateway.use_case: Used to allow a public EC2 instance to connect to and serve the internet.
